dmca.title: [Fwd: [ABUSE] Re: one of your sites is pirating software]
dmca.body:
nc

-----Original Message-----
From: The Planet Policy Enforcement [mailto:abuse@theplanet.com] 
Sent: Tuesday, July 05, 2005 11:17 AM
To: copyright@theplanet.com; unfungames@gmail.com
Subject: [Fwd: [ABUSE] Re: one of your sites is pirating software]

-----BEGIN PGP SIGNED MESSAGE-----
Hash: SHA1

Your email is being forwarded on to our Copyright counsel for review, at the
address of copyright@theplanet.com.

- -------- Original Message --------
Subject: [ABUSE] Re: one of your sites is pirating software
Date: Fri, 1 Jul 2005 14:19:49 -0600
From: UnFun Games <unfungames@gmail.com>
Reply-To: UnFun Games <unfungames@gmail.com>
To: abuse@theplanet.com, legal-response@theplanet.com, support@theplanet.com
References: <E1DfeM5-0007Nr-P8@detritus.ecwhost.com>

You are hosting an account that is pirating sofware.

The website in question is http://www.fsohosting.com

This website has been pirating unFun Games software for awhile now. I got
their last account shut down at ecwhost.com because they were pirating. I
have included all of the email transcripts with ecwhost.com who had to
terminate their account because they continued to pirate software.

the pirated software in question can be found at:
http://www.fsohosting.com/list.php?c=mainfiles

The LEGAL distribution for New Worlds Online is at
http://www.newworldsonline.com






On 6/7/05, Nick, EcwHost support <support@ecwhost.com> wrote:
> I have suspended the user again, and shall ensure upon any 
> unsuspension that the user removes all content related to distribution 
> of this game is removed.
> 
> > He is continuing to sell the software. I am still receiving emails 
> > daily from people who are telling me it's still going on, and I can 
> > see that it is from his website:
> >
> > http://www.fsohosting.com/stuff.php
> >
> > He has also changed the name from FSO to "Lost World" in an attempt
> to
> > keep the site. The game is the same. I spent 2 years developing FSO.
> > You can't make the exact same game overnight, which is what he's 
> > claiming he has done.
> >
> > Nothing has changed on his website since his suspension began. All 
> > of his sales links must be removed. The only thing that he is 
> > allowed to distribute is the free client. He cannot offer the server 
> > software or source code in any way. He is also offering server 
> > hosting on his website. This is also illegal. Each server was only 
> > granted a 1 seat license for runtime. He is copying the server 
> > software multiple times on the same computer and allowing people to 
> > access it without having to download it.
> >
> > Thanks,
> > Robert Mulvany
> > unFun Games
> >
> > On 6/1/05, Your Name <support@ecwhost.com> wrote:
> > > The user emailed me, promising to stop selling the software, he 
> > > has been unsuspended, and has a period of grace in which to do so.
> (His ip
> > > address indicates he is in australia)
> > >
> > > > I emailed you this message a few days ago and you suspended this
> > > site,
> > > > but now the site is back online and continues to sell pirated
> > > software
> > > > that I developed.
> > > >
> > > > the website is http://www.fsohosting.com
> > > >
> > > > The software that they are selling is illegal. The legal website
> for
> > > > selling this software is http://www.newworldsonline.com
> > > >
> > > >
> > > >
> > > > ---------- Forwarded message ----------
> > > > From: Nick, EcwHost.com <support@ecwhost.com>
> > > > Date: May 29, 2005 2:24 PM
> > > > Subject: Re: one of your sites is pirating software
> > > > To: UnFun Games <unfungames@gmail.com>
> > > >
> > > >
> > > > UnFun Games wrote:
> > > >
> > > > >One of your hosted websites is selling pirated software via
> PayPal.
> > > > >The website is:
> > > > >
> > > > >http://www.fsohosting.com/
> > > > >
> > > > >I did a whois lookup on the domain and saw that ecwhost.com
> > > registered
> > > > >the domain, so I assume that it is a site hosted on your
> network.
> > > > >
> > > > >The software being sold is First Star Online (FSO). I am the
> creator
> > > > >of this software and this user is selling and distributing it 
> > > > >illegally. The site that sells this software legally is New
> Worlds
> > > > >Online (http://www.newworldsonline.com). The legal package
> includes
> > > > >the FSO software as an add-on to New Worlds Online.
> > > > >
> > > > >Thanks in advance for a quick resolution to this problem.
> > > > >
> > > > >-Robert Mulvany
> > > > >unFun Games
> > > > >
> > > > >
> > > > Thank you very much for informing me of this, the user has been
> > > suspended.
> > > >
> > > > --
> > > > Regards,
> > > > Nick,
> > > > The EcwHost Team.
> > > >
> > > >
> > >
> > > --
> > >
> > >
> >
> >
> 
> --
> Regards,
> Nick, EcwHost.com support
>


- --
Thanks,
Policy Enforcement
The Planet Internet Services, Inc.
http://www.theplanet.com/aup/
